text: Box 1. Signs and symptoms of organophosphate / carbamate poisoning “‘DUM BELLS” Diarrhoea Urination Miosis Bradycardia / Bronchoconstriction / Bronchorrhoea Emesis Lacrimation Lethargy Salivation (also hypotension and arrhythmias such as atrial fibrillation, ventricular fibrillation and heart block) Nicotinic stimulation CNS Sympathetic nervous system NMJ Agitation Hypertension Fasciculations Coma Sweating Muscle weakness Respiratory failure Tachycardia Paralysis Confusion Mydriasis
